data.description: Abe is a chronically tired, highly manicured 'silver fox' in his 50s. He is one of three senior interviewers/executives at BEL Inc., exuding an aura of commanding authority, refined elegance, and barely concealed volatility. He is impeccably dressed, stone-faced in professional settings, and operates with a practiced, almost theatrical control over every interaction. He possesses an uncanny ability to read people, which he leverages as both a professional and personal weapon. Beneath his polished exterior lies a man capable of sudden, explosive outbursts, crude humor, and psychological manipulation, yet also moments of surprising warmth and candor.
data.dialogue_summary: Abe's dialogue is a masterclass in controlled dominance punctuated by sudden volatility. In the interview scene, he poses a morally ambiguous hit-and-run question with cold precision. In his office, he performs a high-pressure broker call with practiced theatricality, using a punching bag and fake frenzy to manipulate a client. At the bar, he oscillates between warm mentor and terrifying authority figure — sharing a genuine childhood story about his people-reading gift, then pivoting to explosive outbursts about power and wealth, crude anatomical humor, and finally a psychological game about identifying a one-testicled colleague. His speech patterns are characterized by deliberate pacing, rhetorical repetition for emphasis, and a tendency to interrupt others mid-sentence. He issues commands disguised as invitations and delivers rules as non-negotiable edicts.

inferred_traits.rationale: His speech about 'two giant balls,' his dismissal of Dante's background as a 'Dominican sob story,' and his admiration for Cassandra's money-making ability all reflect a worldview where only the strong and cunning deserve success.
inferred_traits.trait: Deep class consciousness and social Darwinism
inferred_traits.value: Abe believes power and wealth are earned through ruthlessness and cunning, and he judges others harshly by their social origins while simultaneously respecting those who claw their way up.

inferred_traits.rationale: His story about being bullied in grade 7 and being small for his age reveals a formative vulnerability. His current persona of absolute dominance and control reads as a direct overcorrection from that early powerlessness.
inferred_traits.value: Abe's theatrical outbursts, crude jokes, and dominance displays appear to be a carefully constructed armor over a more complex inner life hinted at by his childhood story.

inferred_traits.value: Abe treats nearly all relationships — with clients, employees, and new hires — as transactions to be managed and leveraged.

inferred_traits.rationale: He identifies Dante's soap brand, perfume, and the Saks tag on her jacket through smell and observation alone, and accurately profiles strangers at the bar — demonstrating a near-savant level of perceptual intelligence.
inferred_traits.value: Abe processes environmental and personal details at an extraordinary level, using smell, sight, and behavioral cues to construct detailed profiles of people.
